beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Little Sugar MTB. Bentonville, Arkansas. 30 mi. 30 miles, 3.5 thousand ft. 70% singletrack, 30% gravel/dirt. Bentonville MTB trails. Technical Ozarks terrain. Technical rating: 4/5.
beats.text_on_screen: Little Sugar MTB | Bentonville, Arkansas | 30 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Technicality. 5 out of 5. Technical enough to ruin your day on wrong tires. Tgoods describes "85% singletrack, with most being loose over hard with a lot of chatter" and "little kickers that will require your lowest gear. Prestige. 5 out of 5. The one people ask about first. Race Quality. 5 out of 5. Everything about this race is dialed. Life Time's professional organization shows in the details—GPS navigation requirements, strategic aid station placement, and strict crew access rules. Experience. 5 out of 5. Transformative. People come back different. Point-to-point from Coler Mountain Bike Preserve to Downtown Bentonville Square delivers pure theater across 85% singletrack. Community. 5 out of 5. Strangers become friends by mile ten. Bentonville's bike-obsessed culture shows in every detail—Power13 calls the trails "some of the best in the country. Field Depth. 5 out of 5. Start line looks like a WorldTour bus exploded. Life Time Grand Prix status brings out the entire US XC elite field, plus international talent like Matt Beers. Logistics. 4 out of 5. Smooth operation. Somebody knows what they're doing. Point-to-point from Coler Preserve to Downtown Bentonville requires shuttle planning, but Life Time handles the heavy lifting professionally. Adventure. 4 out of 5. The kind of ride you'll tell stories about.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast. Elevation. 3 out of 5. Enough vertical to remind you gravity exists. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Length. 1 out of 5. Short enough to call a training ride. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Oxygen plentiful. Power output normal.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: New LTGP MTB Race in MTB Mecca. You need advanced MTB skills and bulletproof tires. this isn't gravel cosplaying as mountain biking, it's legitimate XC suffering on sugar-sharp limestone that sounds like riding on glass. The Ledges at mile 39 will humble anyone who hasn't spent serious time on technical singletrack. Skip it if you can't handle extended conga lines or if your idea of technical is a gravel road with potholes.
beats.text_on_screen: New LTGP MTB Race in MTB Mecca — 77/100
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Little Sugar MTB isn't quite right for you. Leadville 100 MTB gives you the same XC marathon distance with bigger climbs but less technical chaos. Big Sugar Gravel the following weekend offers similar terrain punishment but on gravel, not singletrack. better for riders who want Ozark suffering without the MTB skills requirement.
